metadata.title: CVE-2017-7109 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 isaffected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11 isaffected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. A cross-site scripting(XSS) vulnerability allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scriptor HTML via crafted web content that incorrectly interacts with theApplication Cache policy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.18.0-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
qtwebkit-source package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
